name: axc11
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0
body: |- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))

stmt.origin: aecoms(s0, s1, wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))

body.origin: |- wi(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))

comment: Show that ~ ax-c11 can be derived from ~ ax-c11n in the form of ~ axc11n . Normally, ~ axc11 should be used rather than ~ ax-c11 , except by theorems specifically studying the latter's properties. (Contributed by NM, 16-May-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 21-Apr-2018.)
